title: Eddie Sauer
text: Edward A. Sauer (November 27, 1898 - February 1980) was a professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who played during the early years of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a>. A resident of <a href="Van%20Buren%20Township%2C%20Darke%20County%2C%20Ohio">Van Buren Township, Ohio</a>, Sauer attended and played football for nearby <a href="Miami%20University">Miami University</a>. He made his NFL debut in 1920 with the <a href="Dayton%20Triangles">Dayton Triangles</a>. Sauer also played for the <a href="Pottsville%20Maroons">Pottsville Maroons</a> and won the 1925 NFL Championship with the team before <a href="1925%20NFL%20Championship%20controversy">the title was stripped from the team due to a disputed rules violation</a>. he also played with the <a href="Akron%20Pros">Akron Pros</a> and the <a href="Canton%20Bulldogs">Canton Bulldogs</a> of the early league.
